p.s: A Unit Test framework for writing tests in your php code docstrings.
p.d:
Testing_DocTest allows the developer to write unit tests directly in the &lt;code&gt;&lt;/code&gt; blocs of your functions, classes and class methods doc comments.
It comes with a default runner (phpdt) that will parse all your &lt;code&gt;&lt;/code&gt; blocs and will run the extracted tests. Running tests is as simple as:
$ phpdt /path/to/your/code
There are several advantages in using Testing_DocTest: * it makes unit tests writing funnier, easier and quicker (there's no infrastructure to setup, you just install the package, write your code examples tests and you're done !); * it ensures that doc comments are up-to-date by verifying that all examples work as documented; * it enforces writing of tutorial documentation, liberally illustrated with input-output examples.
